pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw:
Currently looking into a problem here. My test case is:

1. Insert a sphere
2. Follow the sphere using the right-mouse menu
3. Put the camera is static follow mode.
4. Apply a force to the sphere to make it move along the x-direction.

The camera will jump back and forth.
content.html:
Currently looking into a problem here. My test case is:

  1. Insert a sphere
  2. Follow the sphere using the right-mouse menu
  3. Put the camera is static follow mode.
  4. Apply a force to the sphere to make it move along the x-direction.

The camera will jump back and forth.

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw: The problem is that the camera is configured to inherit the yaw rotation of the tracked visual, and with a rolling sphere, this means that it will alternate between 0 and PI, hence the jumps. I added an option to configure whether this behaviour should be activated or not. For aircrafts, it makes sense to enable it by default.
content.html: The problem is that the camera is configured to inherit the yaw rotation of the tracked visual, and with a rolling sphere, this means that it will alternate between 0 and PI, hence the jumps. I added an option to configure whether this behaviour should be activated or not. For aircrafts, it makes sense to enable it by default.

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw: There are a lot of conflicts, probably because this branch had been merged into `visuals` and then removed, so the merge tool doesn't know if they should be removed or not. Manually merging from default should fix it.
content.html: There are a lot of conflicts, probably because this branch had been merged into visuals and then removed, so the merge tool doesn't know if they should be removed or not. Manually merging from default should fix it.

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw:
It would be nice to have a working example. I added `<track_visual>` tag to `random_velocity.world` for example, I think it would be ok to either add it to that world or create another similar world as an example.

~~~
    <gui>
      <camera name="user_camera">
        <track_visual>
          <name>box</name>
        </track_visual>
      </camera>
    </gui>
~~~

So just with this default value, the camera seems to be moving with the model, but it is not oriented towards it, even though the SDF documentation says that "In any case, the camera will always follow the model by changing its orientation."
content.html:
It would be nice to have a working example. I added <track_visual> tag to random_velocity.world for example, I think it would be ok to either add it to that world or create another similar world as an example.

    <gui>
      <camera name="user_camera">
        <track_visual>
          <name>box</name>
        </track_visual>
      </camera>
    </gui>

So just with this default value, the camera seems to be moving with the model, but it is not oriented towards it, even though the SDF documentation says that "In any case, the camera will always follow the model by changing its orientation."

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw:
The problem is that there are still two modes that coexist in this pull request:

* Follow a model at any time
* Track a visual at startup

The parameters in track_visual now affect both modes.

The first mode should work well and be affected by all parameters except the `name` element.

The first mode requires the `name` element to be set and its behaviour is the same as before this pull request:

* The camera does not change its orientation
* One cannot exit this mode

I just made a change to this pull request (and the related pull request in sdformat) to make sure that the second mode does not become activated by default. It is now mandatory to provide a visual name to enable this mode.

I am not sure if that second mode is still needed. I have never been able to use it effectively, but it is the only mode that tracks a visual and not a model, so it may be useful in that regard.
content.html:
The problem is that there are still two modes that coexist in this pull request:

  • Follow a model at any time
  • Track a visual at startup

The parameters in track_visual now affect both modes.

The first mode should work well and be affected by all parameters except the name element.

The first mode requires the name element to be set and its behaviour is the same as before this pull request:

  • The camera does not change its orientation
  • One cannot exit this mode

I just made a change to this pull request (and the related pull request in sdformat) to make sure that the second mode does not become activated by default. It is now mandatory to provide a visual name to enable this mode.

I am not sure if that second mode is still needed. I have never been able to use it effectively, but it is the only mode that tracks a visual and not a model, so it may be useful in that regard.

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw:
It's not very clear to me why we would have two modes instead of one. As I understand it, the only difference between the right-click-follow and the startup-track-visual is that one is set the moment the world is loaded. But I would expect both to have the same parameters to be configured and it should be possible to escape either of them by pressing Esc. Is there a reason to have 2 different behaviours?

Also, I don't understand how you would follow something without specifying a name. 

I think there might be some sort of misunderstanding about the words "visual" and "model". The current follow mode which can be triggered by right-clicking something is essentially tracking a `rendering::Visual`. The GUI allows you to either track a "model visual" or a "link visual", by right-clicking it on the left panel and choosing Follow.
content.html:
It's not very clear to me why we would have two modes instead of one. As I understand it, the only difference between the right-click-follow and the startup-track-visual is that one is set the moment the world is loaded. But I would expect both to have the same parameters to be configured and it should be possible to escape either of them by pressing Esc. Is there a reason to have 2 different behaviours?

Also, I don't understand how you would follow something without specifying a name.

I think there might be some sort of misunderstanding about the words "visual" and "model". The current follow mode which can be triggered by right-clicking something is essentially tracking a rendering::Visual. The GUI allows you to either track a "model visual" or a "link visual", by right-clicking it on the left panel and choosing Follow.

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.html:
The two modes are implemented in two different ways. With startup-track-visual, inherit_orientation is always set to false, and min_dist and max_dist are always ignored. This pull request does not change this behaviour.

The main difference between the two approaches is that, in one case (startup-track-visual), the camera is added as a child scene node to the visual node:

    _visual->GetSceneNode()->addChild(this->sceneNode);
    this->sceneNode->setInheritOrientation(_inheritOrientation);

And, in the other case (right-click-follow), the position of the camera is set according to SDF parameters in Camera::Update().

I would not mind removing the startup-track-visual mode altogether as it introduces confusion and does not bring anything new apart from its implementation that differs greatly from the right-click-follow mode. Instead of calling Camera::AttachToVisual() in MainWindow.c, we could call Camera::TrackVisual() and send the event gui::Events::follow to display the message "Press Escape to exit Follow mode". I believe that would be much more user-friendly.

pullrequest.title: Static camera when following a model

content.raw:
I see. I think the implementation is not important as long as we get the desired behaviour. If we must change the current implementation of startup-track-visual, which doesn't even work properly anyway, we should change it. I wouldn't worry about changing what is already there if it isn't very useful. I think the most important thing is to have a useful tool with a clear expected behaviour.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but after looking at the 2 pull requests I think the desired specs would be:

* `Right click a model  -> Follow` - the camera starts following the model with the default distance and orientation.

* `Right click a link -> Follow` is also possible

* It is possible to specify a model/link/visual (name) from the SDF to track from startup.

* No matter how the tracking was triggered, it should be possible to configure parameters on the left panel (under GUI->camera?) and changes are observed in real time

* It's also possible to specify other follow configurations on SDF without setting a specific entity to be tracked. In that case, when follow mode is triggered with right-click, those parameters are used unless they've been changed in the GUI. (I assume that's what you meant by not specifying a name)

* No matter how the tracking was triggered, the "Press Escape to exit Follow mode" message is displayed and Escape works.

* After escaping, it is possible to right-click another model/link to follow it
content.html:
I see. I think the implementation is not important as long as we get the desired behaviour. If we must change the current implementation of startup-track-visual, which doesn't even work properly anyway, we should change it. I wouldn't worry about changing what is already there if it isn't very useful. I think the most important thing is to have a useful tool with a clear expected behaviour.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but after looking at the 2 pull requests I think the desired specs would be:

  • Right click a model -> Follow - the camera starts following the model with the default distance and orientation.

  • Right click a link -> Follow is also possible

  • It is possible to specify a model/link/visual (name) from the SDF to track from startup.

  • No matter how the tracking was triggered, it should be possible to configure parameters on the left panel (under GUI->camera?) and changes are observed in real time

  • It's also possible to specify other follow configurations on SDF without setting a specific entity to be tracked. In that case, when follow mode is triggered with right-click, those parameters are used unless they've been changed in the GUI. (I assume that's what you meant by not specifying a name)

  • No matter how the tracking was triggered, the "Press Escape to exit Follow mode" message is displayed and Escape works.

  • After escaping, it is possible to right-click another model/link to follow it

content.raw: Yup, this doesn't go into gazebo7 until we check ABI.
